metadata.author: Better Mobile Security Inc
metadata.comments: Solution template for BETTER Mobile Threat Defense (MTD)

metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup

properties.description: BETTER Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) data connector with template
BETTER Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) data connector with template version 2.0.1

connectorUiConfig.title: BETTER Mobile Threat Defense (MTD)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The BETTER MTD Connector allows Enterprises to connect their Better MTD instances with Microsoft Sentinel, to view their data in Dashboards, create custom alerts, use it to trigger playbooks and expands threat hunting capabilities. This gives users more insight into their organization's mobile devices and ability to quickly analyze current mobile security posture which improves their overall SecOps capabilities.

sampleQueries.description: All threats in the past 24 hour
sampleQueries.query:
BetterMTDIncidentLog_CL
            | where TimeGenerated > ago(24h)
            | sort by TimeGenerated
            | limit 100

sampleQueries.description: Enrolled Devices in the past 24 hour
sampleQueries.query:
BetterMTDDeviceLog_CL
            | where TimeGenerated > ago(24h)
            | sort by TimeGenerated
            | limit 100

sampleQueries.description: Installed applications in the last 24 hour
sampleQueries.query:
BetterMTDAppLog_CL
            | where TimeGenerated > ago(24h)  and  AppStatus_s  == "installed" 
            | sort by TimeGenerated            
| limit 100

sampleQueries.description: Blocked Network traffics in the last 24 hour
sampleQueries.query:
BetterMTDNetflowLog_CL
            | where TimeGenerated > ago(24h)  and  Status_s == "blocked"
            | sort by TimeGenerated
            | limit 100

dataTypes.name: BetterMTDIncidentLog_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
BetterMTDIncidentLog_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: BetterMTDDeviceLog_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
BetterMTDDeviceLog_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: BetterMTDAppLog_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
BetterMTDAppLog_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: BetterMTDNetflowLog_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
BetterMTDNetflowLog_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
BetterMTDIncidentLog_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

BetterMTDDeviceLog_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

BetterMTDAppLog_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

BetterMTDNetflowLog_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions are required.

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key).

instructionSteps.description:
1. In **Better MTD Console**, click on **Integration** on the side bar.
2. Select  **Others** tab.
3. Click the **ADD ACCOUNT** button and Select **Microsoft Sentinel** from the available integrations.
4. Create the Integration:
  - set `ACCOUNT NAME` to a descriptive name that identifies the integration then click **Next**
  - Enter your `WORKSPACE ID` and `PRIMARY KEY` from the fields below, click **Save**
  - Click **Done**
5.  Threat Policy setup (Which Incidents should be reported to `Microsoft Sentinel`):
  - In **Better MTD Console**, click on **Policies** on the side bar
  - Click on the **Edit** button of the Policy that you are using.
  - For each Incident types that you want to be logged go to **Send to Integrations** field and select **Sentinel**
6. For additional information, please refer to our [Documentation](https://mtd-docs.bmobi.net/integrations/how-to-setup-azure-sentinel-integration#mtd-integration-configuration).

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key).

instructionSteps.description:
1. In **Better MTD Console**, click on **Integration** on the side bar.
2. Select  **Others** tab.
3. Click the **ADD ACCOUNT** button and Select **Microsoft Sentinel** from the available integrations.
4. Create the Integration:
  - set `ACCOUNT NAME` to a descriptive name that identifies the integration then click **Next**
  - Enter your `WORKSPACE ID` and `PRIMARY KEY` from the fields below, click **Save**
  - Click **Done**
5.  Threat Policy setup (Which Incidents should be reported to `Microsoft Sentinel`):
  - In **Better MTD Console**, click on **Policies** on the side bar
  - Click on the **Edit** button of the Policy that you are using.
  - For each Incident types that you want to be logged go to **Send to Integrations** field and select **Sentinel**
6. For additional information, please refer to our [Documentation](https://mtd-docs.bmobi.net/integrations/how-to-setup-azure-sentinel-integration#mtd-integration-configuration).

metadata.description: Workbook using the BETTER Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) connector, to give insights into your mobile devices, installed application and overall device security posture.
